title: Quick Navigation (title hidden)
body:
The Exploring Beginner Component Module is now complete.

Select the Previous button to return to the previous module, or the Next button to continue to the Next Module.

To go to the Main Menu, either select the Return to Main Menu button, or select the Home button on the top left corner.

title: Accordion Component
body:
You can use the accordion component to present learners with a series of headings, which once selected, expand to reveal associated text.

The maximum recommended number of headings is eight within a component.
instruction: Select each title to learn more. Open/read all 4 accordions to complete this activity.

_items.title: ITEM TITLE #2 - Steps in a process
_items.body:
Here you can add text with steps in a process. Example of doing laundry:

  1. Sort the clothing by color.
  2. Sort the clothing by fabric (e.g. delicates).
  3. Special instructions for certain fabrics (e.g. dry clean only).
  4. Place the clothing in the washing machine.
  5. Add detergent.

_items.title: Regular Item
_items.body:
Add regular paragraphs:

Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book.

Lorem Ipsum has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged.

_items.title: Text with graphic
_items.body:
You may want to do the accordion with text and an image. If you do so, ensure consistency. Text with image for all the headings or just text.

This is a demonstration only.

Reminder: if your image is decorative, no alternate text is required.

We will go more in-depth about images in a future module.

title: Graphic Component
body:
In a graphic component, you can display or hide the title, and you may also choose to display some text or not. If your image is decorative, you do not need to add "alt text" for your image.

When adding your image from the Asset Management, simply select "autofill" for the image to be uploaded to both to the Large and Small graphic section.

title: Text Component
body:
This is the body of the text component.

If you are doing a copy & paste from another source into Adapt, use the paste as plain text icon (clipboard with a letter T) to insert your text.

Rule of thumb, use bold and italized sparingly.

Italics should only be used for the following:

  • Title of books, pamphlets, published reports, films, most works of art, newspapers, magazines and other periodicals;
  • Complete name of policies, court cases, statutes and acts; and
  • French or foreign words that have not been anglicized.

title: What is Adapt?
body:
To do any job effectively, you need tools that can help you do the work. In construction, you have tools to help you put in nails and screws, to cut wood, etc.

To create eLearning, you need tools to help you build your course; these are called eLearning Authoring Tools, or eLATs. Many companies offer eLATs: Adobe has Captivate, eLearning Brothers has Lectora (previously known as SNAP), dominKnow has DominKnow ONE, and other tools are open source, like Adapt.

Some are harder to use and some easier, but all of these eLearning Authoring Tools do the same thing: they make it easy to create eLearning without needing to know any programming.

title: Adapt - Graphic Component
body:
At ESDC, we use Adapt.

Adapt is a free (open source software) eLearning Authoring Tool. What makes it easy to use is the way it structures a course.

The best model to explain the structure of an Adapt course is a magazine.

A magazine consists of pages with articles, paragraphs, pictures, stand out quotes, etc. Adapt lets you build courses the same way.  

Let’s look at the typical magazine layout and compare it to the Adapt structure.

title: Magazine graphic
body:
A MAGAZINE has:

PAGES with ARTICLES,

ARTICLES with PARAGRAPHS and

PARAGRAPHS with interesting ELEMENTS.

title: Magazine
body:
Magazine

  • Every Magazine has a Name.
  • In a magazine, there are PAGES. Each page (or set of pages) has information on a topic or subject.
  • On a page, depending on the size of the magazine, there is one or more ARTICLES. Each article has a Headline and may have a Kicker (abstract). When articles are grouped under the same topic, there might be a Running Head so the reader can tell that each article deals with the same topic.
  • The body of an article consists of a number of PARAGRAPHS (body text). Each paragraph is on the article's topic, but has a different key point or message. Some paragraphs will have a Subhead, and some may not.  
  • To make a magazine more interesting and to keep the attention of the reader, many paragraphs have attention pieces called ELEMENTS. Elements include pictures (images), word art (Pull Quotes) or lists in a box that further highlights a point.

title: Adapt course
body:
Adapt

  • In Adapt there is a Course Title, which is like the name of a magazine.
  • In Adapt, a course consists of PAGES. Each represents a new subject, lesson or learning activity.
  • In Adapt; each page can have as many ARTICLES as needed. These articles can have “Article Titles” and text to explain what is coming. Typically, each article on a page will be on the same topic, but may explore different parts of the topic. The “running title” in an Adapt course is the Page Title.
  • In Adapt, each article is made up of many BLOCKS (paragraphs). Just like in a magazine, each block points out a key message. As with a paragraph, some of the blocks may have a visible Subheader (block title), and some may not.
  • In Adapt, every block consists of one or two "COMPONENTS" (elements). These can be text, graphics, videos, etc., all to ensure the learner is engaged and attentive.

title: Adapt course graphic
body:
An Adapt course has:

PAGES with ARTICLES,

ARTICLES with BLOCKS and

BLOCKS with interesting COMPONENTS.

title: Quick Navigation
body:
This concludes the Adapt eLearning Authoring Tool module.

Select the Next button to move on to the next module. In the next lesson, we will look at what a page, article, block and component look like in a course.

To access the main menu, select the Return to Main Menu button or the Home button located in the upper left corner of the page in the navigation section.

title: Quick Navigation
body:
To access the main menu, select the Return to Main Menu button or the Home button located in the upper left corner of the page in the navigation section.

If you are done with the course, close this browser.

title: Comments / Feedback
body:
Thank you for taking the time to participate in this Adapt Authoring Tool - Beginners pilot. Please join us from 2:00pm to 3:00pm (EST) to provide us with your comments and feedback. The link to join us on MS Teams is available in your calendar invite.

Your comments / feedback are very important and will allow us to make the final changes to our course before its official launch in September.

title: Ready for your account creation
body:
Now that you have completed the Adapt Authoring Tool - Beginners on-line course, you are ready to have your account created. Please email us at the following address to obtain a username and password:

NC-SIGA-SABA-APPRENTISSAGE-ILMS-SABA-LEARNING-GD@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca

title: Learning Objectives
body:
The authoring tool allows you to quickly build HTML5 content without knowing coding.

In this course, you will learn about:

  • The basics of the Adapt Authoring Tool
  • A plain language description of the Tool
  • A few basic components to get you started

title: Quick Navigation
body:
This concludes the Introduction module.

Select the Next button to move on to the next module.

To access the main menu, select the Return to Main Menu button or the Home button located in the upper left corner of the page in the navigation section.

title: Introduction
body:
Welcome to the Adapt Authoring Tool - Beginner online course.

This course is mandatory for all new Adapt users. After completing this online course, you will receive an Adapt username and password to familiarize yourself with the Authoring Tool. You will also be invited to attend the instructor-led virtual class, which will cover how to create eLearning training in Adapt.

This course should take you approximately 45 minutes to complete.

title: End of Course
body:
Congratulations! You have now completed the Adapt Authoring Tool - Beginner on-line course.

You will be invited to register in Saba to attend an instructor-led virtual class which will cover how to create online eLearning training.

title: Next Course
body:
In the next instructor led course, you will learn more about:

  • Different components (presentation and question components)
  • Preview, Publish and Export
  • Asset Management
  • Accessibility Best Practices

title: Instructions Video
body: This video is a step-by-step process of how to add a new course in Adapt.
instruction: Select the play button below to start the video and/or select the transcript button to read the narration.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
Once you have logged into the Adapt authoring tool Dashboard:

  • Select the green button labelled Add new course located at the top left of the screen.
  • In the field labelled Title: Enter a course title and select the button labelled Save.

When you select the Save button, Adapt will automatically add a page to the course build.

To change this Page's title:

  • Select the gearwheel button labelled click to edit and select Edit from the options given.
  • In the field labelled Page title: Enter a new Page title.
  • Select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Course structure page.

This is the first step to building your course!

title: Instructions Sample Video - Add a Block
body: When utilizing the Accordion component, the impacts are at the BLOCK and COMPONENT levels.
instruction: Select the play button below to start the video and/or select the transcript button to read the narration.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
Double click on the page you have just created and named. Adapt will bring you to the back-end of the authoring tool framework (Page structure) where the Page title, a New Article, a New Block and a New Text Component are automatically created and presented. Each time that you create a new course, the first page is populated with these items.

At this stage you can change/update:

  • The Page title (if applicable);
  • The New Article Title; and
  • The New Block Title.

There is an option to add content (text) at the PAGE, ARTICLE, and BLOCK levels, but it is not mandatory.

You will learn more about this in future modules.

The Text Component can be changed or updated with additional information. To do this:

  • Select the gearwheel button labelled “click to edit” and select Edit from the options given.

There is an option to add additional content (text) in the field labelled Body (current text displays as "This is a text component").

You will learn more about this in future modules.

At the BLOCK level you must select the option "Add block".

A new BLOCK is added to the page. 

You have the option to add a title at the element labelled BLOCK title:

  • Select the gearwheel labelled "click to edit" and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the name of the Block (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Page structure page.

A new BLOCK can consist of one (full width) or two (one on the left and one on the right) COMPONENTS.

This new BLOCK allows you to add a COMPONENT. There is an option to add content (text) here at the COMPONENT level, but it is not mandatory.

You will learn more about this in future modules.

To add a COMPONENT you must:

  • Select the button labelled Add Component. 

A side panel of available Adapt components appears on the right of the screen.

  • Select or type the word Accordion from the list of available components.

There are three (3) buttons that will appear:

  • Add to left;
  • Add full, or
  • Add to right.

For this exercise select the button labelled Add full.

A full width Accordion COMPONENT is added to the page.

title: Text on Building Course for Practice
body:
The best way to ensure you understand the principles introduced is by creating your own simple course using the Adapt Authoring Tool. Refer to the concepts learned in the "Exploring Components" section of this course.

Consult the Resources section for helpful links and Job Aids:

  • MeD SharePoint - link to be bookmarked
    • Consult the Adapt section for extra documents, including the Best Practice and Instructions guide
  • Adapt job aid user information
  • Log into your Adapt account job aid

Should you have any additional questions in regards to concepts that have not been covered in this Beginners course, please refer to the Adapt Super User of your Design Team.

title: Instructions Sample video - Add Accordion component
body: When creating content for the Accordion component, the impact is at the COMPONENT level.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
You can now create the content for the COMPONENT:

  • Select the gearwheel button labelled “click to edit” and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the title name of the Component (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Written content (text) can be added to the box labelled Body (if applicable).

Scroll down to Properties section to the box under the Instruction section: 

  • Instructions must be added to ensure learners navigate the component properly (e.g. Select each title to learn more on (...). Open/read all 4 accordions to complete this activity.) [Refer to the Best Practices and Instructions Adapt Authoring Tool guide.]

Select the button labelled Add. A side panel will appear with options to:

  • Add an Item Title.
  • Add item body content (type text in this box).

Once you have added the item title and body content use the navigation bar to scroll down.

  • Select the button labelled OK.
  • Select the button labelled Save.

Congratulations, your first Accordion heading has been created!

To add more headings repeat the process, from the Select the button labelled Add instructions above. 

The maximum recommended number of headings is eight within this component.

Select the button labelled Save once all headings have been added.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Page structure page.

title: Instructions Sample video - Add a Block & Graphic Component
body: When utilizing the Graphic component, the impacts are at the BLOCK and COMPONENT levels.
instruction: Select the play button below to start the video and/or select the transcript button to read the narration.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
At the BLOCK level you must select the option "Add block".

A new BLOCK is added to the page. 

You have the option to add a title at the element labelled BLOCK title:

  • Select the gearwheel labelled "click to edit" and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the name of the Block (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Page structure page.

A new BLOCK can consist of one (full width) or two (one on the left and one on the right) COMPONENTS.

This new BLOCK allows you to add a COMPONENT. There is an option to add content (text) here at the COMPONENT level, but it is not mandatory.

You will learn more about this in future modules.

To add a COMPONENT you must:

  • Select the button labelled Add Component. 

A side panel of available Adapt components appears on the right of the screen.

  • Select or type the word Graphic from the list of available components.

There are three (3) buttons that will appear:

  • Add to left
  • Add full, or
  • Add to right.

For this exercise select the button labelled Add full.

A full width Graphic COMPONENT is added to the page.

You can now create the content for the COMPONENT:

  • Select the gearwheel button labelled “click to edit” and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the title name of the Component (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Written content (text) can be added to the box labelled Body (if applicable).

Select the button labelled Select an Asset. Adapt will navigate to the asset management library where you will choose the appropriate graphic. There is an option to upload a new asset (graphic), but you will learn more about this in future modules. For this exercise type the word "map" in the Search box:

  • A listing of all the map graphics currently available in Adapt will be displayed.
  • Choose the first map displayed.
  • Select the button labelled "Autofill".

Adapt will save your graphic choice and take you back to the Component settings page.

Above the graphic you just added is a box labelled Alternative Text. Add a brief description of the image (e.g. map of Canada).

You will learn more about this in future modules.

Select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Page structure page

Congratulations, your first Graphic component has been created!

title: Instructions Sample video - Add a Block & Text Component
body: When utilizing this component, the impacts are at the BLOCK and COMPONENT levels.
instruction: Select the play button below to start the video and/or select the transcript button to read the narration.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
At the BLOCK level you must select the option "Add block".

A new BLOCK is added to the page. 

You have the option to add a title at the element labelled BLOCK title:

  • Select the gearwheel labelled "click to edit" and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the name of the Block (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your work and take you back to the Page structure page.

A new BLOCK can consist of one (full width) or two (one on the left and one on the right) COMPONENTS.

This new BLOCK allows you to add a COMPONENT. There is an option to add content (text) here at the COMPONENT level, but it is not mandatory.

You will learn more about this in future modules.

To add a COMPONENT you must:

  • Select the button labelled Add Component. 

A side panel of available Adapt components appears on the right of the screen.

  • Select or type the word Text from the list of available components.

There are three (3) buttons that will appear:

  • Add to left
  • Add full, or
  • Add to right.

For this exercise select the button labelled Add full.

A full width Text COMPONENT is added to the page.

You can now create the content for the COMPONENT:

  • Select the gearwheel button labelled “click to edit” and select Edit from the options given.
  • Enter the title name of the Component (if applicable) in the field under the box labelled Title.
  • Written content (text) is added to the box labelled Body.
  • Scroll back up and select the button labelled Save.

Adapt will save your typed or paste as plain text content and take you back to the Page structure page.

You will learn more about this (paste as plain text) in future modules.

Congratulations, your first Text component has been created!

title: Tips
body:
This course is designed to be interactive. 

As you navigate through each module, you will see different interactive elements that contain more information or activities.

You will need to:

  • open each available accordion window (up/down);
  • select each button (where applicable); and
  • select the Continue button to navigate through each page of this training; please note the Continue button becomes activated only once the section is complete.

The page level progress at the top right of the page and above the module on the main menu indicate your progress within that module.

Please select the Open courses' resources button, located in the top right corner of this window, to access the following:

  • Glossary: to consult any unfamiliar terms;
  • Resources: to view additional resources for this course;
  • Search: to search words in this course.

Note: the hyperlinks included in the Resources section open in a new tab. These links are accessible from the network.

title: Instructions Sample video - Preview a Course
instruction: Select the play button below to start the video and/or select the transcript button to read the narration.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody:
To Preview your course:

  • Select the button labelled Preview course.
  • Adapt will open another tab/window with the created course Home Page.
  • You will see the name of your course, and the name of your first lesson/topic.

Once the course loads in another tab/window select the button labelled View.

Adapt will showcase the items currently included in the first page of the course.

Scroll down to see the Accordion, Graphic and Text components you created.

Ensure that you select and open all interactive elements.

Congratulations, you have just previewed your first course!

You can use the X to close out the tab you previewed the course on, and speak with the Adapt super user on your team for more information.

title: Special Instructions for the Pilot - graphic
Special Instructions for the Pilot
body:
For the purpose of this pilot:

  • watch the demo in each of the components;
  • click/select the View Transcript button to view the step by step process of the demo.

NOTE: for the official launch, a correction will be made to the title "Titre ICE/Title HERE" to read as "Titre ICI/Title HERE" in each of the animations. Also, a narration will be added to correspond with the text appearing in the View Transcript.
